options.a: Search Engine Optimization
options.b: Social Engagement Online

title: What is the primary goal of SEO?

options.a: To make a website look visually appealing
options.b: To improve a website's visibility and ranking in search engine results
options.d: To optimize the speed of a website

options.a: A search result with no relevance to the query
options.b: A result that appears naturally in search engine rankings, not as a paid advertisement
options.c: A result that uses artificial intelligence
options.d: A result from a non-profit organization

options.a: A type of website
options.b: A special search engine for ranking purposes
options.c: Search Engine Results Page, the page that displays the results of a search query

options.a: Research on new programming languages
options.b: Research on the latest fashion trends
options.c: The process of finding and analyzing search terms that people enter into search engines

options.a: SEO performed on an outdoor location
options.b: SEO focused on optimizing individual web pages for search engines

options.a: SEO performed outside of regular business hours
options.b: SEO that focuses on improving a website's authority and reputation through external factors

options.a: A link that takes you back to the homepage of a website
options.b: A link from one website to another
options.c: A link to a previous search query

options.a: A summary of a book
options.b: A short description of a web page's content, displayed in search engine results

options.a: A type of insect
options.b: A program used by search engines to scan and index web pages
options.c: A type of robot used in manufacturing

title: What is the 'sitemap' of a website in SEO?

options.a: A map for physical navigation
options.b: A list of all the pages on a website, used to help search engines index the site

title: What does '301 redirect' mean in SEO?

options.a: A traffic jam on a highway
options.b: A permanent redirect from one URL to another

options.a: Content copied from a book
options.b: Content that appears on more than one web page, either within the same website or across different websites

options.a: A text used in sailor's messages
options.b: The clickable text in a hyperlink
options.d: Text written on a ship's anchor

title: What does 'SERP ranking' mean in SEO?

options.a: A ranking of superhero movies
options.b: The position of a web page in search engine results for a specific keyword

options.a: A type of social media URL
options.b: The preferred version of a web page when multiple URLs have similar content

options.a: Text in an alternative language
options.b: Text used to describe an image for accessibility and SEO purposes
options.c: A text used in alternative medicine
options.d: A text used in alternative rock music

options.a: The speed of a website's server
options.b: The time it takes for a web page to load and display its content to users
options.c: The speed of a website's security
options.d: The speed of a website's database

options.a: A file that controls a robot's movement
options.b: A file used to communicate with web crawlers and tell them which pages they can and can't crawl
options.c: A type of robot used in space exploration
options.d: A file used to block access to a website

title: What does 'SERP features' mean in SEO?

options.a: Features on a search engine results page (e.g., featured snippets, knowledge panels, etc.) that provide additional information beyond traditional organic results
options.b: Features of a sports car

title: What is '301 vs. 302 redirect' in SEO?

options.a: The difference between two types of highways
options.b: The difference between a permanent (301) and a temporary (302) redirect
options.c: The difference between two programming languages

title: What is 'SERP click-through rate' in SEO?

options.a: The rate at which people click on search engine results
options.b: The rate at which people click on advertisements
options.c: The rate at which people create websites
options.d: The rate at which people take photos

options.a: A type of link that doesn't pass authority to the linked page
options.b: A type of follow-up email

options.a: The title of a book
options.b: The title of a web page, typically displayed in search engine results and browsers

title: What is '301 redirect chain' in SEO?

options.a: A series of road signs for redirecting traffic
options.b: A chain of multiple 301 redirects in a row

options.a: An audit of financial statements
options.b: A comprehensive analysis of all the content on a website to assess its quality, relevance, and performance
options.c: An audit of social media accounts

options.a: The rate at which people bounce on trampolines
options.b: The percentage of visitors who navigate away from a site after viewing only one page
options.c: The rate at which people bounce basketballs
options.d: The rate at which people bounce in dance clubs

options.a: A type of programming code
options.b: A meta tag that instructs search engines not to index a specific web page
